nodes.bodyText: The idea of limiting that to 11 is that you can define on maximum WSYYYY/YYYY, for example WS2020/2021 which are 11 characters. Ping @jpbernius, @krusche.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+<?xml version="1.1" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
+<databaseChangeLog xmlns="http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/dbchangelog" xmlns:ext="http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/dbchangelog-ext" xmlns:pro="http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/pro" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/dbchangelog-ext http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/dbchangelog/dbchangelog-ext.xsd http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/pro http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/pro/liquibase-pro-3.9.xsd http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/dbchangelog http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/dbchangelog/dbchangelog-3.9.xsd">
+    <changeSet author="franke" id="20201015224743">
+        <addColumn tableName="course">
+            <column name="semester" type="VARCHAR(11)"/>

nodes.bodyText: I would not be too strict here. Please set it to 25 in case we might have longer values in the future

nodes.bodyText: this should not be mutually exclusive. We should be able to set test and semester and then we should also display both

nodes.bodyText: this enum already exists somewhere else. please reuse it
It is only defined in tutor-group.model.ts. Is there a good common/general place I can move this to? (Depending on tutor-group here is kind of weird.)
